Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
CAN: The student can identify and draw a simple representation of a habitat, such as a garden or pond, though details may be limited.
The student can represent basic features of common plants, like simple trees and grasses, in at least one habitat.
The student can depict some animals in their habitat, like a fish in water or a bird on a tree, but not very detailed or accurate.
CANNOT: The student may struggle to accurately depict different types of habitats (e.g., may mix land and water features inappropriately).
The student may not include a variety of plants in each habitat or may confuse similar plants (e.g., drawing a pine tree in a pond habitat).
The student often omits or misidentifies animals, such as placing a desert animal in a forest scene *(misunderstand habitat-specific species)*.
The student may lack ability to show how the types of living things vary across different habitats and does not make visible comparisons.
The student may show inconsistent patterns in the diversity of plants and animals, possibly drawing similar living things in all habitats without recognizing diversity.
